raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Autoimmune endocrinopathy", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has classic features of IPEX syndrome (Immune dysregulation, Polyendocrinopathy, Enteropathy, X-linked), which is caused by mutations in the FOXP3 gene leading to defective regulatory T cells. The syndrome is characterized by early-onset enteropathy (chronic diarrhea), eczematous dermatitis, failure to thrive, and a high risk of autoimmune endocrinopathies such as type 1 diabetes mellitus and thyroiditis.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
